info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 25 at 8:35PM CDT by NWS Marquette MI
info.description:
...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Michigan...
Sturgeon River near Alston affecting Baraga and Houghton Counties.
Michigamme River near Witch Lake affecting Marquette and Dickinson Counties.
Michigamme River near Republic affecting Marquette County.
.Recent rain and snowmelt will continue to result in elevated river levels.
* WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by rain and snowmelt continue.
* WHERE...Michigamme River near Republic.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 7.7 feet, Water begins to impact the yards of homes near Bengtson bridge on County Road LI in South Republic
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:20 AM EDT Friday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain near stationary through this weekend. - Action stage is 8.4 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette.
The next statement will be issued Saturday morning.Saturday morning at 1100 AM CDT /noon EDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
